website_summaries.verdict: The perfect pacifier for the teething baby. Unique design allows this pacifier to perform double duty.
pros: While it functions better as a teether than a pacifier, it does let a baby suck for comfort or chew for relief
Soft but durable silicone that can take the wear and tear of tiny teeth
A great option for early teethers
cons: Nobby nipple design makes it a less effective pacifier

customer_reviews.title: better than other toys at higher price points
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves these when she's in teething pain. We have two. She doesn't really use it as a pacifier, more as a toy to bite down on. My baby does love pacifiers, by the way (she only takes the MAM brand). It seems to provide some relief...better than other toys at higher price points. I was sad to find these so late in the teething game- it would have saved me a lot of wasted money on inferior products. I hope this review gave you some insight into the product, if so, please hit YES at the bottom of the review where it says "Was this review helpful to you?"
customer_reviews.author: socal

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: 3 month old loves this teether. It is easy for him to grab onto and he really seems to like the raspberry-like texture. When I bought it I thought he would use it as a pacifier and leave it in his mouth, but he usually just grabs onto it by the handle and chews on it. The nipple area is larger than a pacifier, so he can't really use it as such. the nipple is very flexible and soft. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Isa

customer_reviews.title: we LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: No wrong way to use it, we LOVE this thing! My daughter will chew on the leaves, the handle, and suck and chew the berry. I do wish they would bring back the old design with a closed berry on the back (like a binky is) bc you could fill them up with water or breast milk and freeze. We still do with this version but it makes a little more mess.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for baby grip + chewing
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had trouble finding something good for our 4 month old for teething. We now have a collection of failed teethers either because he couldn’t fit it in his mouth or hold it right... This “binky” teether is PERFECT! He’s able to grip on it and turn it around and chew from all sides. As you can see in this picture, it’s really flexible and gummy on all sides. He loves it so far and I would recommend for anyone else having similar issues for their little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Cute. But does not serve it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: It's really cute, I was hoping that all The Ridges on it would help my son with his teething issues .But so far I don't see it giving any relief. It's quite bendy and flexible, more than I was anticipating and not much kick back when you squish it. So I'm not quite sure if this is going to do its purpose but it does look really cute which is why I gave it a good rating. Looks exactly like a raspberry but for how it's advertised I feel it should taste like a raspberry and it does not so don't expect that. I didn't expect it but I was wondering if it was going to or not. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: ally

customer_reviews.title: Strong Odor
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same product a few years ago and really liked it. However, this time, the product I received is defective. As soon as I open the package, a strong odor overpowered my nose. Even after boiling it in water for 5 minutes, the odor still didn't go away. Out of concern for safety, especially since it is for baby use, I threw it away. Not sure it is a knockoff product from Amazon or a defective product from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jianjun Qiu

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this teether! The small numbs on the raspberry make it comforting for her to chew. It also has a nice loop on the handle which makes it easy for her 9month old fingers to get a hold of. It is very durable. I used the same one with my older daughter when she was teething and she chewed very hard. It is very easy to clean with the silicone material.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 4 month old
customer_reviews.text: My (almost) 4 month old daughter loves this teether! She’s been chewing on everything she can get her hands on for a few weeks and I’ve bought several other teethers (Winkel ball, Nuby keys, etc.) but they’re all a bit too big and awkward for her to hold at the moment. This one is great because she can hold it really well by herself and can even get the raspberry part in her mouth without help! The little handle is great and she can chew on the whole thing which is a win.
customer_reviews.author: N H

customer_reviews.title: Don't think about it just order it!
customer_reviews.text: Why did this not exist earlier in human history. The fact this exists now shows we will be sleeping more and getting more quiet time to cure all diseases and limitations as a species... Disclaimer some people have finicky kids so it might not work, but this thing does the job it advertised so don't blame the razz...
customer_reviews.author: Ciampa Family

customer_reviews.title: Red raspberry teether.
customer_reviews.text: I hope my soon-to-be-here granddaughter likes this teether! It's very colorful, with green leaves and bright red teether. The Pacifier has bumps on it to soothe and massage sore, aching gums. It is made of soft silicone that can be FROZEN for added comfort. Some reviews say their baby doesn't like this pacifier. I think it is that way for most teethers and toys. There are some toys that baby likes, and some that baby doesn't like. I think it is a well-made and durable, colorful pacifier. Have not actually seen it in use because baby hasn't arrived yet. That being said, upon reading the description and seeing the product up close, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay cold very long
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this product several different ratings. I would give 5 starts for texture - it's pretty awesome. 3 stars for it being for 3+ months. The nipple is large and a 3 month old (mine did) would have trouble keeping it in their mouth. My daughter really started enjoying it at 5 months after starting solids and had more strength to hold the teether. 2 stars for it staying cold; you have about a minute and a half max. Also, be sure to check the price. Amazon sells them as a singles or in a pair and the pair is more expensive. Better off buying two singles.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: So I originally purchased maybe 6 different teething toys for my son as he began showing signs of eruption. I opened others but intended to return this one. I’m so glad I didn’t have to return it (thanks amazon!) cause this ended up being my sons favorite toy. The silicone texture is strong and durable for chewing and I’m sure the spheres of the raspberry design feel good on the gums. I put it on a pacifier string and he’s got it within arms reach all day long. Happy baby, happy momma!
customer_reviews.author: Symone A

customer_reviews.title: Bought for early teething
customer_reviews.text: the product looks exactly as described and came in the same packaging as shown. My daughter is now almost 4 months. I brought this because of the ratings in the signs of early teething the only issue I would say that I had was that it was a little big for her mouth then I did love that I could freeze it and there was no issues with that as well as being able to sanitize and wash it was a lot easier as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rica Hankerson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Teether!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect teether!! My baby is having a hard time with teething, more than my other kid ever did. Her top teeth are coming in and causing a lot of pain. I've tried a lot of teethers and this one has been her favorite. It's perfect to grip with her hand. She holds it herself and chews on it. It has helped calm her down in her most painful teething moments. Even baby Motrin doesn't always do the trick. This does!
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Good for older & bigger babies
customer_reviews.text: My DD is four months old. This is an awesome product overall & once she is bigger I know she will love it, but now the berry part is so big she doesn’t like to use it like a paci. She just puts the tip in & chews on that some, but it is a little too big for her at this point. I wish they made a smaller sized one for smaller babies.
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teething baby to hold onto!
customer_reviews.text: We have been searching for the best teething toy that would keep our little one entertained for longer than 10 seconds. This by far has been the best thing yet! It is shaped like a pacifier so it is something familiar for the little ones to hold onto easier and longer. Our little girl has been obsessed with the texture of this along with how easily she can hold onto it to pop it in and out of her mouth against her gums essentially massaging them as she is teething. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Baby made my brother use it too
customer_reviews.text: Its 5 star in all areas but my child did not like it much and does not spend lot of time with it so taking off a star from it rest washing, teething and carrying is all 5 star. Funniest thing my baby did was took it out from his mouth and put it in my brothers mouth and kept his hand on it so he doesnt take it out.. lol.. probably baby thought my brother (25yrs) was also teething. Have lovely memory with this teether though.
customer_reviews.author: Siddharth Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Provides teething comfort to your LO
customer_reviews.text: My baby is a few weeks shy of 6-months old and starting to gnaw, tug on her ear, be grumpy and show other classic signs of onset teething. I bought this RaZberry teether bases on great reviews, and was glad I followed the herd as she absolutely loves it, has no problem holding it in place and appears to take delight in the sensation and relief that the little sturdy raspberry 'bobbles' provide.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperUSA

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for myself, a 21 year old with adult teeth, because I found myself clenching my jaws a lot and causing damage to my teeth. Whenever I feel the need to clench my jaws, I bite on the pacifier instead and it helps a lot. It’s very durable even on adult teeth! This is probably one of the best pacifiers you could get. It’s worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Anna P.

customer_reviews.title: My baby does not take it
customer_reviews.text: If you have teether buffet at home, this is unnecessary to get. If you don’t have teether, I recommend this. My baby does not take pacifier so does this style teether. He only put in his mouth one two second then throw on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Cashew Mom

customer_reviews.title: My baby didn’t want it
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t seem to work for anything. Whose idea was that I wonder. It is just some pacifier that is rougher and sturdier. It is big for my baby. It is hard to chew on when the baby is teething. Nothing with this teether seems right for a baby to chew or bite. There are much better and more populat teethers out there to choose from. Wouldn’t recomment this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this with my baby. He enjoyed chewing on it but got the entire thing lodged in his mouth. It scared him and me. We won’t be using it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. She started early teething at 2 months it was too big to fit all the way in her mouth at first but by the time she really started getting her teeth in she loves it, it's her favorite teething toy. The ridges and bumps on it give an interesting texture for her and massages her gums. Its hollow, goes into the freezer well for cooling relief and is super flexible and bendy
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm with supervision
customer_reviews.text: I offered this to my 3-month old baby and so far is the only teething toy that he can grab for about 30 seconds since he is learning to control his arms but also the shape of the raspberry is comfortable for him. My baby does use a pacifier but I would not recommend using it in that way. Instead, hold it for him and let him pull, push, and chomp at his own rhythm.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves this teether!
customer_reviews.text: The physical design, shape and color of this teether are so appealing that it's a hit every time I take it out of the freezer. The texture seems to be soothing and it gets several minutes of use. But unlike teethers that are water / gel filled, this one is not and as a result it does not remain cold for longer than a minute at best. But the texture must still be good because baby enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good starter
customer_reviews.text: It's a good teether to start with, it's small and light weight. It is recommended for 3 months+ but my baby started the signs of teething at 2 months so I looked for something small for her since a lot of teethers are a bit large. It's working out well so far. She can't hold it yet or have it in her mouth but I do hold it for her and she seems to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Estrella

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Only one tiny complaint on design
customer_reviews.text: I give 5 stars overall, but only 3 for the actual reason of teething. The reason for that is because the razz part collapses when bitten, and seemed to anger my son (because he prefers to bite hard things with textures for his teething; like silicone legos). Other than that, these things are tradition in my family to be a baby's first teething item, and I had to keep that going.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething especially cold!
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my teething little one. She used it a lot when she was like 3-6 months old but now she doesn't care for it (7-9 months). When she actually used it - it did help her a lot. The grooves on it help massage the gums - the design doesn't retain water like some other pacifiers do - and if you stick it in some ice water before giving it to your baby it helps a lot with the pain as well!
customer_reviews.author: GetFit NoExcuses

customer_reviews.title: good teether, but hard to clean inside
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars because my baby do love this and use it for a while. The only down side is not easy to clean, even though I tried few things to clean the inside pocket of the raspberry,still looks dirty after few months of uses. Recommend buy few more ,change them every 2 months
customer_reviews.author: bradybunch323

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my baby but might work for yours
customer_reviews.text: My baby just doesn’t like pacifiers so he didn’t really use this a whole lot. I’m not going to fault the manufacturer for that. A lot of my mom friends recommended this to me since it worked so well for their babies who were teething. I would say if your baby likes pacifiers, there is a good chance that this will work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette S

customer_reviews.title: Not for infants
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend for a infant teething. It’s way to big to fit in their mouth. I also don’t agree with the concept . It’s not exactly something they can but down on. My son is 3 1/2 months . Maybe this will be better when he’s older but for now I’m not a fan of it .
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cesarano

customer_reviews.title: I usually pop it in the fridge for a few and she likes it even better. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My little babe loves this thing she is almost five months and gnawing on everything. I usually pop it in the fridge for a few and she likes it even better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 9 month old
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this teether when my grandson was 5 months old but he’d just started teething and he didn’t quite know what to do with it yet. Now, at 9 months old, it is one of his favorite teethers. He just holds onto the green ring and gnaws on the raspberry part. It seems to really relieve his discomfort!
customer_reviews.author: L in Longmont

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby makes a happy mommy
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it!! I couldn’t be more happier with my selection! It is very easy for her to old and move around! I recommend this for anyone that has a child that is just starting to chew on things!
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Nice teether
customer_reviews.text: I think I love the concept more than my son does. I love that it's a pacifier teether and easy to hold. I think the bumps all around are great. My 5.5 month old son (two teeth so far) seems indifferent to it so far. It's still a really nice quality, hoping he eventually takes to it! I think it would make a unique nice addition to a gift
customer_reviews.author: Bippy

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then expected but worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger then expected but worth the buy. If baby teeth’s early they can bite the green leaves until They are big enough to bite the raspberry. However it teaches them how to have hand control and within a week my just turned 4month old son could Handle this himself and place it in his mouth. This you just doesn’t soothe but it teaches extremely important skills. A must have
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: BAD SMELL AND TASTE Only 3 stars hoping it gets read. I can't believe it took me so long to realize the nasty smell then I literally tasted it and about threw up
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Davis

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 4 months old and she loves it! I was sick of seeing her bite her hands or trying to bite me! Teething rings don’t help this pacifier is perfect. I don’t know if it is because she is young still but she always drops it . Its a bit bigger than I thought but still does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Tiara

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Your baby needs this! My baby girl loves this teether. At first she wouldn’t reach for it much because it was a little big for her mouth, but now she uses it all day. It’s her favorite. It’s easy to hold, easy to clean and a great; super cute teether.
customer_reviews.author: Estefanny Sigala

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: My baby has a little obsession with this one. I love that you can actually put it in the freezer the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that i wished it stayed cool for a little longer in less than 2 min. It’s not cold anymore. Other than that this is a great item for teething. Oh and it’s super easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Does not freeze.  A little too firm
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these thinking they were chewier or at least froze for aching gums. It seems like the perfect teether but in reality its kind of rough and not soothing. You also aren't supposed to let your child use it as a pacifier. My kid would rather chew on the handle than the raspberry, but even if he did like it, I couldn't let him just suck on it. Pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teether!
customer_reviews.text: 6mo baby loves this raspberry (shaped) teether. It's ready to grasp and easy for baby to teeth as it's perfectly designed to put on her mouth and with the the little ' raspberry 'nubbies' make it really a perfect teether. Happy baby-happy mommy!
customer_reviews.author: BAF

customer_reviews.title: Such a Cute and Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Gave it to my baby around 6 months and she loves it! She chews on every part of it so I love all the extra texture they put on it, and it’s convenient to use with pacifier clips so it’s not constantly being dropped (or thrown). I have a petite baby and this fit her mouth just fine at 6 months. I would say the raspberry is roughly the size of two pacifiers nipples. I was worried it would be too big but it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: This was the first thing my baby ever held so it was cool for that purpose she does seems to enjoy the texture and if she’s going to use a teethed this would be the one but my baby doesn’t enjoy tethers too much in general she’s rather eat her hands
customer_reviews.author: Mr+MrsDimauro

customer_reviews.title: My baby surprisingly loves it!
customer_reviews.text: So I was hesitant to purchase being I had gifted this and the baby didn’t like it. Now just like any other teethers he will get his Gum massage for a few min. & then dismiss it. But I do like having a variety so as one is being cleaned I have a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute teething pacifier
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute pacifier for teething. Easy to clean. Freezes quickly. Soft silicone. No sharp edges. Lightweight for my baby. Appears to be easy to hold for her. Helps with her teething. She keeps in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: my baby did not like this at all
customer_reviews.text: It was very big and bulky, my daughter did not like this at all, it was large for her little mouth , easy to hold but pretty much a pacifier with raised areas, a little too hard for what she is needing.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Williams

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: When my baby needs to chew on something I give him this. The raspberry is not hard which is nice for chewing. Design is nice with the vines on the handle part and super easy to clean. Would recommend for a teething baby.
customer_reviews.author: KittyKat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teething babies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one when my little one was 4 month and her first teeth were coming in. She loved it so much I purchased two more to have on stand by. It is easy for her to hold and I can tell it feels good on her gums when she chews on it. We've even thrown it in the freezer first. She also looks super cute when she's chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but not a favorite
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler went through a major chewing phase when she was getting her first sets of molars, so I bought these when she was constantly destroying pacifiers. She wasn't very impressed with them, although she did chew on them a little. I keep them in the freezer, and she'll still occasionally grab one when the freezer is open and gnaw on it. She probably would have liked them better when she was younger - but I will say that they've held up against her chewing!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Works good, easy to clean and tote around
customer_reviews.text: This is one of mine and my son’s favorite teething toy. He also just up and decided he didn’t want a pacifier one day but he still likes this teether because it’s a lot different than a pacifier. He chews all sides and ends of it.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why exactly but my baby absolutely LOVES this feather. It’s her go to toy. NO it doesn’t smell like raspberries and it doesn’t claim to. She loves it frozen but she will take it anytime. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Best teether
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used this specific one yet, but we've used them in the past with our first child. It helped tremendously. A tip I learned it to get it wet and then put it in the freezer for a little while before giving it to your little one to chew on. (Helps to soothe the areas where their teeth are coming through)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for my last 2 so got another one for my newest little. It would be great if they made different sizes. She started teething early and it’s too big for her mouth right now but I know it works and she will grow.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, if only kid would use it
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who designed these things but my child refuses to use it and he chews on everything including dog toys. It's well made and sturdy enough not to accidentally get a hole. But if the kid won't use it, it's pointless. I think more R&D is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R Jean

customer_reviews.title: Baby and Mommy Loves IT
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product for my three month old grandson. His Mother says he loves it. He has begun to start teething and this Teether is a life safer for Mother and Dad. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute Teether, Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started using this around 3months and has just recently started wanting it again now that her molars are coming in. Great teether and great price! We like to keep it in the freezer also!
customer_reviews.author: A Brancazio

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter stopped taking a pacifier at 4mo but still likes to chew on them. This is perfect for teething babies and she has loved it the past 3 months. Since it’s the size of a pacifier it’s easy to clip to her shirt with a paci clip and keeps her happy while we’re out and about and we can leave bigger teethers at home. Definitely worth getting one!
customer_reviews.author: MrMrs Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I just don’t know why my son don’t like it he eat on me all the time I give him the raspberry he look at it and throw it he only 5 months old and boy my nose hurts he eats on my face finger head anything he can get too on my body he eats
customer_reviews.author: Antionette Williams

customer_reviews.title: Happy Buyer
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 yr old was chewing everything and had a biting problem...found this and it changed the game! Easy to hold in mouth and easy to hold in hand! She is so happy and when she has the urge to bite or chew she grabs it
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Voeltz

customer_reviews.title: Grandson and granddaughter both loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson who has autism. He chews on his shirt so I would give this to him when he started to chew on his shirt. He likes the RaZbaby but his shirt still gets soaked. My daughter bought one for my granddaughter who is teething and she loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great teether for bigger babies
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this and it's actually quite pretty but it's too big for my baby. I thought it would be smaller and fit unlike most teething toys but this one too is too big. She is a preemie though (born at 27 weeks) so even though shes 6 months shes tiny and that's probably why. It's not the products fault that's why I give it 5 stars because if it did fit it would be great
customer_reviews.author: Angelika

customer_reviews.title: Excellent teether!
customer_reviews.text: Best teething toy! My son would never take a pacifier but he loves this now that he is getting his bottom two teeth. Easy to hold. And I love that I can put it on a pacifier clip and bring it on the go with us. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Helps with teething.
customer_reviews.text: This is a little big for baby right now. However in a month or so will be perfect. She seems to love it and it has helped with teething thus far. She loves when its frozen and placed on her lips and gums. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby hates it
customer_reviews.text: My baby absolutely detests this thing. You can put any other toy in her mouth and she chomps away...not this thing. I’m pretty sure it has to be the texture. Had high hopes but nope.
customer_reviews.author: Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great teether  for 9/10 months+!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 10 month old! He started teething closer to 7 months though and it was a bit too big for him then. He didn’t like it at all, but now that he’s bigger he likes it much more. I would definitely recommend this for like 9/10 months+. I’ve even cooled it for him and it seems to provide some pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany W

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the size
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think it’s made for a two month old baby. It was too big for my baby’s mouth and she couldn’t hold it anyway ( as expected). She’s now 5 months and it’s still too big for her to comfortably bite on it.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Well made product!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really tried it with my daughter yet. She will be 3 months old soon. That's the age the packaging indicates the use for this starts at. But it's well made. Easy to clean! Hopefully she likes it!
customer_reviews.author: TNM86

customer_reviews.title: Thumbsucker approved
customer_reviews.text: My kid is a thumb sucker but he loves this and uses it when he is teething hard. He chews on the vine handle part and on the raspberry. He got one as a gift and we had to buy more. Best teether ever!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product because it’s cute! But my daughter hates it. It’s a bit rough not soft like some teethers. And I try to keep it cold for her but it just warms up quickly and she doesn’t grasp it well either.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Cute design, baby likes it so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright colors and great texture. Baby seems to really like this teether/pacifier so far. I thought it would be a little stiffer for being a tether but it’s actually pretty soft. Like the hollow center which makes it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Easy to grasp with tiny hands/learning to grasp...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It took me forever to find something that my baby could easily hold. He is just now learning to grasp things and the small ring on the front of it is perfect for him! He loves it also!
customer_reviews.author: LandscapeGirl

customer_reviews.title: NoGo for my baby
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would be good in theory but my baby is just not interested. Its just too ribbed and a bit difficult to hold. Not all babies are the same, so your Little may actually like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Cute and effective
customer_reviews.text: Our little one has been teething since he was 3 months old and this has helped keep him distracted. He loves it and it helps his sore little gums. Not to mention it's adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Tanukikai

customer_reviews.title: I usually leave it in the fridge to keep it cool, then he nibbles away to soothe his gums
customer_reviews.text: At first my son didn't care for this, but now at 6 months he chomps away at it. I usually leave it in the fridge to keep it cool, then he nibbles away to soothe his gums. He doesn't take pacifiers so I was pleasantly surprised at him taking this. He even tries to chew on the little 'leaf' sides. Anything to help soothe those gums and he takes is an A+ with me.
customer_reviews.author: creaTIFF1

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old baby loves this! He smiles and reaches for it when I give it to him. He usually doesn't use a pacifier. I bought it when he was 4 month and at first he didn't quite have the dexterity so I had to hold it for him. Now he holds it and chews for 5 minutes straight.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: My 6 month old couldn’t hold it and was not very excited about this silicone teether
customer_reviews.text: My baby prefers wooden and more hard feeling teethers than the silicone teethers like this one. Pros: Easy to clean Looks nice Hands free Cons: Too soft for a teether
customer_reviews.author: Kirthi

customer_reviews.title: Not great for teething
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this seemed more like it was for the tongue and roof of mouth and not something for the baby to chew on or rub her gums on. She put it in her mouth and got this weird look on her face and threw it down. She was around 3 months and now she’s 5 months and still doesn’t want anything to do with it. I’ve purchased every teething toy known to amazon and this is the only one that my daughter didn’t like
customer_reviews.author: Carol Burchett

customer_reviews.title: and to go to sleep I absolutely love this item I bought her a second one for
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had all of her teeth including her molars by a year old she had a dr. Brown's pacifier which I had to take away because she chewed through it but I kept the stuffed animal toy and attached it to this teether now she's 2 years old and 5 months and she uses this rather than a pacifier helps, and to go to sleep I absolutely love this item I bought her a second one for daycare
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Only stays cold 3minutes
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes it but it only stays cold about 3minutes total. Then he starts screaming because its warm already. Just frustrating it doesn't stay cold for a decent amount of time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every baby is different!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter does not find this very interesting. I thought that the rasberry shape part was solid, but it is not. It is just a thin hollow thing, but i do like that it has lumpy texture to soothe theor gums. My daughter just personally does not care for it!
customer_reviews.author: Danae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these from target (6$) for my cousins son who is 5 months old and teething and he loves it so i bought another for my son who will be here in a few weeks!! And this is the exact same one for half the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelders

customer_reviews.title: Great for rubbing those gums
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about it initially when I saw that the bulb was bigger than his regular pacifier. He actually was a bit apprehensive the first time I gave it to him but he loves it now. My son had already started chewing on the soothie so i felt this would be a good time to get this. Now he's hooked on it. Def get when you see your child starting the teething process.
customer_reviews.author: Renz

customer_reviews.title: Good just keep an eye out
customer_reviews.text: Our child liked it and would like to have it rubbed on her gums to help with the teething. One thing that they don't tell you about is that the bulb is hollow with an opening in it. We would freeze water into it so she could get the cold and the bumps. Only problem with that is water would leak out of it. The lack of a star isn't because of our using it off instructions. The handle isn't on there extremely well and you would have to be careful that it doesn't get ripped off if your kid is into biting and pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Raziel1313

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old is teething and the bumps are so great for her mouth! Bonus is she can suck on it like a pacifier and she even likes to chew on the handle. Excellent quality
customer_reviews.author: Abbie M. Geater

customer_reviews.title: Good teether
customer_reviews.text: Babies liked chewing on it. Don't like it that they can fit the whole thing inside their mouth. Not a choking hazard, but still can put it all in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for an older child
customer_reviews.text: Baby boy hates it. Too big and bulky I think. Maybe best for a 1yo. He's only 4mo and his tiny mouth doesn't like it. He just gags or cried
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Fenimore

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.text: My baby didnt take to it. Doesnt stay frozen for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Grand daughter FAVORITE!
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter was 5 mos old when I got these and she has LOVED this since! Perfect for her grip and right size for biting. I place in freezer and pull out when she needs. I added a leash so she won't lose them as often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly too small but great for teething
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really like this. Seems to feel good on her gums but I think it is too small for her to use because it seems smashed against her mouth when she uses it
customer_reviews.author: Susan T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This teether works wonders. My daughter doesn't like cold things, so she hates refrigerated/frozen teethers. The teething pills only work for a few minutes with her. I was desperate to find anything that might offer her some relief. When I came across this, I thought it was worth trying considering it was so cheap. My daughter absolutely loves it. She takes it with her everywhere. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: amhart87

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my baby and he immediately grabbed onto it and started chewing! He loves it. As with most things you gotta oversee the chewing because he tried to suck on it a couple times and I switched it to his pacifier.
customer_reviews.author: B.R-W

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat the price
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this teether And it has become her new favorite!!
customer_reviews.author: Dare

customer_reviews.title: Teething support
customer_reviews.text: I had this with my older children and they loved them. My youngest doesn't use as much, but as he gets teeth in, I think he will enjoy. I like that they can hold it better than a teething ring and the bumps feel good on the gums.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great teether but a little heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this teether and wish my baby used it more regularly because I think it would help him. That said, he has a little trouble holding it because the raspberry is just a little too heavy for easy handling.
customer_reviews.author: gera lynne clement

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a few of these, my LO loves it. Put it in the fridge and instant comfort for soothing teeth coming in. Bumpy and easy to hold. Fits the nookums. Red! They love the high contrast color instant eye catcher.
customer_reviews.author: Safety

customer_reviews.title: Soothes gums in minutes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my baby girl who started teething a it early at about 2 months. It was too big for her mouth at the time. So we stuck with frozen pacifiers and a bit of vanilla on the gums. She is 5 months now and she NEEDS to have this in her area at all times lol. She loves biting on this little binkie and she has fun putting it in and out of her mouth with ease. I would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danae Baptiste

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: My baby did not know what to think of this. I would even be weirded out by the texture. It’s a bumpy pacifier, not a teething toy.
customer_reviews.author: SMO

customer_reviews.title: Must have for teething babies
customer_reviews.text: Best teether I have ever purchased. My eight-month-old granddaughter is never without it. She will not take a pacifier but she loves this teether.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Zindash

customer_reviews.title: Ehh..
customer_reviews.text: I thought the nipple/ strawberry part would be a little smaller. Instead of being able to chew on it she has to take the whole thing in her mouth and then it’s not really doing it’s purpose bc she can’t move it around
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

product_meta.title: RaZbaby RaZberry Silicone Baby Teether Toy - Berrybumps Soothe Babies Sore Gums - Infant Teething Toy - Hands Free Design - BPA Free - Easy-to-Hold Design - Teething Relief Pacifier - Fruit Shape/Red
product_meta.description:
Color:RedRaZbaby RaZberry Silicone Teether Toy is a stimulating, multi-textured pacifier used to soothe swollen gums and emerging teeth. Perfect texture to chew. This hands-free all silicone teething pacifier can also be frozen for extra comfort. Simply place water in the Teether and freeze. In minutes you have the best cooling teething toy to soothe you newborns tender gums. RaZberry Teether is Non-toxic food grade silicone and is free of BPA, PVC, phthalates, lead and cadmium. All natural and environmentally friendly. Multi Texture Teething surfaces encourage baby teething and grabbing. The ring is texture for a full 360 degrees of teething relief. Conforms to USA Consumer Product Safety Commission requirements. Conforms to EU standards

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
RaZbaby RaZ-Berry teether is a stimulating, multi-textured pacifier used to soothe baby’s gums. This hands-free all silicone teething pacifier can also be frozen for extra comfort. RaZ-Berry is non-toxic, 100% medical grade silicone and BPA-free.
feature_bullets: SOFT SILICONE: Non-toxic food grade silicone and is free of BPA, PVC, phthalates, lead and cadmium
BERRYBUMPS: Patented bumps soothe baby's swollen gums and emerging teeth. Perfect texture to chew
ORIGINAL: RaZberry Teether is the original hands free teething pacifier for babies
PERFECTLY SIZED: Perfectly shaped and sized for your little one's hands. Ages 3 months plus
MULTI-TEXTURE: Multi Texture Teething surfaces encourage baby teething and grabbing

specifications.Safety warning:
For your child's safety: warning:
1. Never attach ribbons or cords to the soother, your child may be strangled by them.
2. In the event that the soother becomes lodged in the mouth, do not panic; it cannot be swallowed and is designed to cope with such an event. Remove from the mouth with care, as gently as possible.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,861 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
